did.unittitle: Letters on the Automaton Chess-Player of Mr. De Kempelen, translated by M.S.N. from the German of Chrelien de Mechel

scopecontent.p: This volume consists of copies of seven letters written in 1783 by de Windisch explaining the Automaton, a machine designed to play chess against a human opponent. The recipient of the letters is not noted. The Automaton was invented by De Kempelen, a Hungarian whose other inventions include an English Fire Engine, and a speaking machine.
